title: Helen Bailey’s murder will be explored in new documentary Murdered By My Fiancé on Channel 5
text:

The story of Helen Bailey ’s murder by her evil fiancé will be explored in a new Channel 5 documentary. 
Ian Stewart, 56, was jailed for at least 34 years for the murder of the millionaire children’s author today. 
And now the first trailer of the new documentary into the case has been revealed. 
Murdered By My Fiancé will show key footage shown to the jury during the trial. Ian Stewart was found guilty of Helen Bailey's murder 
The chilling footage shows Ian being arrested and his subsequent police interview. 
Audio from Ian’s original call to police to report Helen missing will also be heard. 
Meanwhile, interviews with Helen’s close friends and neighbours will paint a picture of the couple’s relationship. 
The documentary promises to tell a “story of deception, greed, lies and murder”. Helen Bailey was reported missing by her partner Ian Stewart (Photo: ITV News Anglia) 
Those close to the case – including journalists – will then tell the story of the “clues that gave him away”. 
While Psychologists and experts will analyse footage of Ian taken during the investigation to reveal how his behaviour ultimately led to his own downfall. 
Helen was missing for three months before she was found in a cesspit at her home with her pet dog. Ian Stewart before he was arrested (Photo: PA) 
Earlier today, a jury took five-and-a-half hours to convict Ian Stewart of ­murder, fraud, preventing a lawful burial and three counts of perverting the course of justice yesterday, as the court heard he may die in prison due to his age. 
Helen, who wrote the popular ­Electra Brown books for teenagers, effectively signed her own death warrant when she made a new will, ­giving Stewart her £4million fortune, just 21 months before her death. 
But after the jury of seven men and five women convicted him of murder, he is not expected to receive a penny. The money will be shared between friends, relatives, ­charities and Stewart’s sons Jamie, 24, and Oliver, 21. Like us on Facebook
